summary: The concept of "mutual assistance among farmers" refers to collaborative practices within the agricultural sector, aimed at enhancing productivity and sustainability. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, this concept underscores the importance of cooperation among farmers to share resources, knowledge, and best practices. Such mutual assistance can facilitate compliance with EU agricultural policies, promote innovation, and improve the resilience of farming systems. By fostering a supportive network, farmers can collectively address challenges such as market fluctuations and environmental sustainability, thereby contributing to the overall objectives of the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) and ensuring food security across the EU.
